channel.title: Gateway AppArmor trouble
channel.description:
After I added AppArmor profiles to Whonix-Gateway (timesync, whonixcheck, sdwdate) and rebooted machine I've got this messages every few seconds:
[code][23637.117523] type=1400 audit(1422484523.061:4898): apparmor="DENIED" operation="open" parent=19413 profile="/usr/bin/timesync" name="/etc/tor/torrc.anondist" pid=19498 comm="te_pe_tb_check" requested_mask="r" denied_mask="r" fsuid=101 ouid=0 [23637.118462] type 1400 audit(1422484523.259:4898): apparmor="DENIED" operation="open" parent=19413 profile="/usr/bin/timesync" name="/usr/share/tor/tor-service-defaults-torrc.anondist" pid=19574 comm="te_pe_tb_check" requested_mask="r" denied_mask="r" fsuid=101 ouid=0[/code]
Before install I switched to Whonix Testers repository and after install to Whonix stable. That all I've done

item.title: Gateway AppArmor trouble
item.dc:creator: stranger98721
item.description:
Yes, I did.
But only after dist-upgrade everything is working properly.

Read full topic

item.title: Gateway AppArmor trouble
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
So you used apt-get update + apt-get install individual-profiles?

Read full topic

item.title: Gateway AppArmor trouble
item.dc:creator: stranger98721
item.description:
Thanks for help. Not it’s working ok

I installed profiles by instructions here:

Whonix – 25 Apr 20

AppArmor

AppArmor profiles (Security Hardening) for Whonix ™ and other Linux distributions.

I used only apt-get update, not dist-upgrade.

Read full topic

item.title: Gateway AppArmor trouble
item.dc:creator: troubadour
item.description:
Thanks for testing and reporting!

Most likely, you did not update after switching to the testers repository.

Re-run whonix_repository, select Testers Repository, then:

sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get dist-upgrade

The apparmor-profile-anondist (where both denied files are located) should be upgraded.

Read full topic
